intro: Malleastrum horokoke, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences at the tips of the stems. Malleastrum horokoke is well adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and is often found in coastal and forested areas. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making baskets, clothing, and other crafts.
